headline: Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs
description: These bacon deviled eggs are a tasty option for any party. Filled with a creamy blend of yolks, mayo, bacon, Cheddar, and mustard, they won't last long!

video.description: Make your deviled eggs better‚Äîwith bacon!
video.name: Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs

name: Bacon Cheddar Deviled Eggs

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil, then immediately remove from the heat. Cover the pan and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove eggs from the hot water and rinse under cold running water to cool.
While the eggs are standing in hot water, cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels, then crumble.
Peel cooled eggs and cut in half lengthwise. Transfer yolks to a bowl.
Add mayonnaise, bacon, Cheddar, and mustard to yolks, then mash to combine. Spoon egg yolk mixture into egg white halves. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: Made it last night for the Super Bowl! They were delicious! I added about 2 teaspoons of Frank's to give it a little kick and some pepper. Topped it off with paprika. They didn't need any salt since there was a good amount of bacon. I will definitely make them again!

I swapped the mayo for Miracle Whip and added 1 1/2 tablespoons of top-grade hot sauce to the mixture. The 7-kids literally inhaled 6-dozen halves before I caught them and had to make more for the adult guests. These were a complete hit at the football party!
Amazing!!!

So good I didn't change a think, except I didn't fill them till right before the event cause I was afraid of them rolling during travel. Well I sampled the filling right after making it and before adding it to the eggs and OMG the bacon was so amazing after letting it sit over night. I think letting the flavors meld then filling made a huge difference.
Delicious. We make these every Easter. Also great for Keto people!
Loved, loved the eggs! I did add the parsley to the mixture instead of just topping and it was phenomenal! Took to church potluck and only brought home one egg!!
Made it as is. GREAT!! Perfect for Super Bowl Sundayüèàüèà
I made this for Thanksgiving dinner with my family! It was a big hit. None left! Only changes I made was to add a shake of sciracha and garlic pepper. Great suggestions and a great recipe.
These are amazing. The only change I made was added crushed up crispy fried onions on top.

Oh my I made this and it was the best!! Everyone loved them. I did tell everyone they weren‚Äôt the usually deviled eggs and to try one. I may get stuck bringing these again because I have chickens and I always have tons of eggs. Oh yea don‚Äôt use you‚Äôre fresher eggs, they don‚Äôt make very good hard boiled eggs for peeling the shells off.

These are yummy! Just a little disappointed that I couldn‚Äôt taste the cheddar cheese. Might increase the amount next time and maybe toss in a little Frank‚Äôs Red Hot. Will definitely make these again and again!
Great! Just it the way the recipe calls for.
Very good! I followed the recipe as written and I wouldn't change a thing! I LOVE the crunchiness the bacon adds to the texture. Might try adding small pieces of onion or chives next time!

This is my first time ever making deviled eggs and these are sooo yummy. I didn't have yellow mustard but has Nathan's Spices Brown and it gave ut a bit if a kick. I'm sure the original recipe is just as good.
So good! This is such a good recipe. The only thing that I changed is that I added some light sour cream in addition to the mayonnaise and also added chives. My husband loved these!
This is a great recipe! Tastes amazing! Perfect for Ostara cooking
good

I used ready to eat packaged real bacon and dijon mustard; dash of salt and some paprika.
Mom said they were the best deviled eggs we have ever had for thanksgiving.
Best deviled eggs ever. I did used extra cheese and made sure to dice the cheese and bacon very fine.
These were excellent. I noticed that the recipe changed from the magazine to the website.
Recipe is excellent as is. I prefer extra cheese in mine but they are great as directed.
Wouldn't change a thing, they're excellent!
My folks were a little dry, so added a little more mayo and they were absolutely delicious.

Such a fun version of Deviled Eggs. I followed this recipe to use up our Easter 
eggs. I had more than 12 eggs so I eye balled the amount of ingredients. I modified the recipe by adding Wickles Original Relish which added a fabulous zest. Yummy for our cheeseburger picnic.
Excellent! Makes deviled eggs at a whole new level!

I've been making these deviled eggs for at least 12 years or more since I discovered the recipe online. I always use more bacon and cheddar cheese than what the recipe calls for because everyone loves them so much when I make them that way! They can't seem to get enough of them, especially my boyfriend!!! Lol
Yummy recipe, full of flavor!
Very good! Needed a good way to use up the Easter eggs since they usually go to waste. Even my kids liked these!
Happy Easter, all turned out great.,enjoy
Me and my daughter really liked them, the hubby did not.
I think it was great, I did cut the mayo to 3 oz. rather than 4oz. but this is only due to personal preference. I loved it and it was simple to make.
Easy and tasty. Don't use fresh eggs.....harder to peel.
I think the eggs needed to cook longer. I added some sweet onion and black pepper
Brought these to a Super Bowl party...they were a HUGE hit! Someone I had never met said "Ohhh...You are always invited!" after eating one of the eggs!
These were just ok. I added pickled jalape√±o because the were missing that acidic lunch for me. The household agreed, we prefer traditional deviled eggs to these.
So much better than traditional deviled eggs!!! Will definitely make again!

Delicious!! Made these for a family get together and they were a huge hit! My hard to please step mother even loved them. Love that this is so simple! I used avocado oil mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and blended with in immersion blender. The texture was perfect. Then stirred in the crumbled bacon. Spooned the filling into the egg whites and sprinkled with Smoked Paprika, best deviled eggs ever!!
Loved it! Made it with 1/2 mayo 1/2 sour cream.
Added a little smoked paprika on top to tie it all together.
I made these for Thanksgiving everybody loved them so much now i have to make them for Christmas
I made these yummy eggs for my husbands Christmas work party. They were a big hit. One person placed a request that I make them again this year. Thank you again for this recipe.
Loved it! A hit with everyone! This is the recipe I will use from now on when making devilled eggs.

I‚Äôve made a few deviled eggs on here, never felt the need to write a review on them but to my shock, people are right, this WAS the hit of the party‚Ä¶ I had Salmon, Shrimp you name it, but out of all I had, most comments were made on these and were gone fast! I did make it pretty much as directed EXCEPT I did add a little hot sauce my friend ‚ÄúFrank‚Äù told me about‚Ä¶ (other hot sauces wont so the same)‚Ä¶ just a few drops to enhance the flavor is all you need.
I found them even better the next day when all flavors blended
Delicious Thanksgiving appetizer; puts a yummy, crunchy spin on a classic. They were a hit!
Easy, basic as far as deviled eggs go, but really tasty and great for bacon lovers (and who's not a bacon lover)...
So good! Was a hit

bacon tends to make them a little salty,but good.
use to my original deviled eggs with onions.
Absolutely fantastic. Will 100% make these again. I didn't think deviled eggs could get any better.
I tried with all the nozzles for the squeeze bag that I had, but I guess the bacon wasn't chopped enough to go through... I also added dill relish which made it that much better. Delicious recipe.
Outstanding deviled eggs. Always a hit.
Delicious. Will make this again and again.
Delicious and very easy to make! They were a hit!
Made these in a double batch and they were gone instantly. Yummy!

I make my hard boiled eggs in the instant pot, and this recipe is great. Please note that I try to make things easy and use Costco real bacon bits, I always add extra cheese, and add seasoning salt and pepper :)
I followed the recipe to the T and they were a huge hit. These will be my go to deviled eggs now.
I didn't make any changes to the recipe. It was perfect. I take it to potluck dinners all the time. My friends keep requesting it over and over.

These were awesome.
I cooked the eggs in our Instant Pot.

Made the recipe with no changes and they were great.
Only thing I would note...we wanted to use a piping bag and tip and pipe in the filling, but the bacon prevented this. Next time I'll leave the bacon out of the filling and sprinkle it on top.

I followed the recipe exactly except I minced some shredded Mexican blend cheese (since it was such a small amount and we keep that shredded cheese on hand) and finely chopped the bacon. I think the textural difference will help. I've only tasted a little of the yolk mix (celebration is later today) but it was delicious! I'm not a fan of normal deviled eggs, made these for my keto-dieting son, but I would take these any day!

Delicious! I used a quart size freezer bag to mash the 9 egg yolks (a sandwich bag is too weak and broke the last time); then I added finely shredded sharp cheddar cheese and 4 slices of turkey bacon bits (equal to approximately 1/4 cup); I added the mustard to the light Duke's mayo then add to the yolk/cheese/bacon mixture. I sprinkled extra bacon bits on top. I have made it without the cheese and was asked to never omit it again. This is definitely a favorite! I have found Oscar Meyer turkey bacon and light Duke's mayo taste the best together.
My first try at deviled eggs, no need to try any other recipe.
These came out great. Made them for Easter I only got to have one everyone else ate them all only problem with making these.
I topped with chopped onion chives
Very yummy!!
We liked it,
I wanted to review these so I could be the ONE THOUSANDTH person to say they are good. Mission accomplished.
The eggs were great. I took them to a cocktail/app party and they were got in 15 minutes!

These were absolutely delicious and were gobbled up so fast that I will have to make them again. My hubby called them tasty little morsels and my son who normally hates deviled eggs was eating them. The only modification I made to the recipe was instead of 1/2 c mayo, I did 1/4 c mayo and 1/4 c sour cream.
I added 1/4 chopped onion and 1/2 tsp pesto to give it a bit more taste. Awesome.
Not bad at all, a change. Though I added little sugar as do in egg salad.
yummy, best flavor if you make them the night before serving
The best deviled eggs I‚Äôve ever had! I have made them many times and they never disappoint.
Definitely a keeper. Delicious! I made it with a little more cheese than the recipe indicated though.
These were a great twist to a traditional recipe. My family loved them. I will make them again.
Very tasty and was a big hit when I served them for a church dinner!

I added the bacon grease to the mixture which gave it more of a bacon flavor also helped keep the mixture smooth and not so chunky and I also added more cheese then the recipe calls for. All in all now a family favorite!
Awesome!!

These bacon cheddar deviled eggs were great. I also substituted bacon bits for real bacon because it saved time. I added a lil salt, a 1/2 tsp sugar, relish and sprinkled with smoked paprika. They are the ????!
Huge hit at thanksgiving. So big I‚Äôm getting death threats if I don‚Äôt make them at Christmas!!

Based on a couple of comments, we omitted the cheese. The wasabi paste we used wasn't all that spicy but lent a subtle piquancy to the eggs. A dusting of smoked paprika provided the perfect finish. Delish!

Fantastic simple recipe. I chose to simplify even more since I was short on time and left out the cheese and bacon. I just added a little salt and sprinkled both pepper and paprika on top. Perfect! I'm sure the cheese and bacon will be even better. I needed to use boiled eggs that I'd pre-purchased before they expired. I just sliced in half and popped out the yolks and 10 minutes later, they were done!
Super tasty! I did 1/2 mayo and 1.2 sour cream and added sun-dried tomatoes. They are a great keto snack.
I added a spoonful of sour cream and about 3 tablespoons of pickle relish. Delicious! It was a big hit at Thanksgiving. I can‚Äôt wait to make it again.
I made this as written, but I smoked the egg whites first. Some folks added a dash of hot sauce while eating. Either way, they were simple and awesome.

Great deviled eggs. I made according to the recipe except I used the same amount of stone ground mustard. I added a small spot of basalmic glaze for decoration and something to add a little more pazazz
An absolute hit!

Great recipe! Have made it several times. One time I realized I had no cheddar cheese so I left it out and did not notice a difference. I have left it out ever since. I always sprinkle the final product with salt, pepper, and cayenne.

Very different and yummy! 
Am serving them at my church class in the morning! I know they will be a hit! : )
Followed the recipe exactly
Great recipe. I did add extra bacon and some diced green onions. I took an empty dish home from the birthday party. Everyone loved them, including me! Thanks for the best deviled eggs recipe.
A tasty change of pace for deviled eggs.
Made this for family event. Gone in 5 minutes!
These are good. I didn't really taste the cheese; I'd maybe add a little more next time. You could jazz them up with some onion, salt, pepper, hot sauce. But they are perfectly fine as is.
Bacon balances flavors well. Used spicy mustard to give it a broader flavor.
These are amazing! These are the only deviled eggs that I like!

When I make these again, I won't add the bacon to the filling until right before I am ready to serve. The bacon was not crispy when I filled these the day before. I saved some to crumble over the top as well.
Great recipe. I used smoked gouda instead of cheddar because that is what I had on hand.

I've been making this recipe for at least 6 years...especially at Easter. The combination of cheese and bacon is nothing short of AMAZING. My slight alterations to this recipe is I use 1/2 tablespoon of mustard and I use Dijon. DON'T use spicy mustard...really leaves a nasty taste. And I use 2/3 cup of HELLMANNS mayo......not imitation. Also, chop the cheese and bacon with a palm chopper really well. If you pipe your filling like I do, the finer the cheese and bacon, the easier it will be to fit through the tip.
Everyone asks me to bring the deviled eggs ever since I brought this recipe.
